info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fulton, southern Herkimer and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Winfield, or 11 miles south of Ilion, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, West Winfield, Jordanville, Cedarville, Oppenheim, Elizabethtown, Warren, Nelliston, Ingham Mills, Spinnerville, South Columbia, Lotville, Rasbach Corner and Mindenville. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern New York.
